headline: at
summary: Former VA police officer now making pre-employment adjudicative decisions on possible government employees and contractors.

defaultPosition.description: Personnel Security. Makes adjudicative analysis determinations on ICE applicants regarding their suitability and fitness to work for the federal government.
defaultPosition.title: Personnel Security Specialist

positions.description: Personnel Security. Makes adjudicative analysis determinations on ICE applicants regarding their suitability and fitness to work for the federal government.
positions.title: Personnel Security Specialist

positions.description: Responsible for enforcement of all offenses against the criminal laws of the United States, the protection of all property, the protection of all civil rights and preservation of all peaceful environments on all property owned and controlled. Also responsible for protecting property from sabotage, espionage, fire and willful damage or destruction, that is controlled by the Department of Veterans Affairs. To also conduct vigorous and inquisitive patrol activity which ensures random patrol patterns, meets special protective service requirements, and provides maximum visibility in corridors, wards, stairwells and building perimeters to prevent the opportunity for crimes such as assaults, the sale or distribution and use of illegal drugs, and thefts of government and personal property.
positions.title: Police Officer

positions.description:
Investigated cases in which company assets have been lost or stolen; recovered assets totaling $37,000, Annually conducted Laboratory Safety Audits to ensure compliance with Environmental Health & Safety standards, Oversaw the Lock and Key program
Interviewed and had input on the placement and removal of officers at Cisco Systems Inc., Responsible for maintaining a weekly 456 hour schedule
Provided weekly reports to upper management, i.e. mileage reports and weekly site specific updates
positions.title: Safety and Security Site Supervisor

positions.description:
Oversaw all security functions by assigning, training, and guiding shift officers. Maintained a sense of security by patrolling all exterior public areas and multiple buildings to include Inpatient and Outpatient facilities.
Showed a constant sense of security by completing hourly rounds, patient watches, and transporting valuables to the hospital safe for patients.Provided input on disaster preparedness procedures and equipment used
positions.title: Shift Supervisor

positions.description:
In charge of processing thousands of secret and top secret security clearances for Keesler AFB. Supervised over 50 security account managers for various squadrons at Keesler AFB. Ensured error free reports were completed in a timely manner; reduced the amount of rejected Security Clearance paperwork. Enforced all state, local, and federal laws and regulations in additions to enforcing all military codes.
Certified in conducting anti-terrorism measures in on and off base housing, entry points and other vital areas on Keesler AFB. Participated in base wide disaster training by setting up traffic control points while maintaining command and control of demanding and stressful situations.
positions.title: Security Forces
